items.title: Pakistan: Three killed in suicide blast at Peshawar headquarters
items.standfirst: A suicide bomber killed three paramilitary officers at the federal constabulary headquarters in Peshawar, while two other attackers were shot dead before entering. No group has claimed responsibility, though similar recent attacks are blamed on the Pakistani Taliban, adding to tensions between Pakistan and Afghanistan.

clusters.title: Vietnam flooding kills at least 90
clusters.neutral_headline: Vietnam Flooding Death Toll Reaches 90
bullet_summary: At least 90 people have died in a week of torrential rain, flooding and landslides in south-central Vietnam, authorities said
Reported by France24, Guardian World

items.title: Vietnam flooding kills at least 90
items.standfirst: At least 90 people have died in a week of torrential rain, flooding and landslides in south-central Vietnam, authorities said. Popular tourist areas have been heavily hit, with parts of Nha Trang submerged and deadly landslides cutting off roads near Da Lat. The relentless rains since late October have caused major disruption and economic losses in the hundreds of millions of dollars.
items.content: At least 90 people have died in a week of torrential rain, flooding and landslides in south-central Vietnam, authorities said. Popular tourist areas have been heavily hit, with parts of Nha Trang submerged and deadly landslides cutting off roads near Da Lat. The relentless rains since late October have caused major disruption and economic losses in the hundreds of millions of dollars.

items.title: Vietnam flooding death toll reaches 90 amid landslides and relentless rain
items.standfirst: Environment ministry says most of the deaths were in the mountainous central province of Dak LakThe death toll from major flooding in Vietnam has risen to 90, with 12 more people missing, the environment ministry said on Sunday after days of heavy rain and landslides.Relentless rain has lashed south-central Vietnam since late October and popular holiday destinations have been hit by several rounds of flooding. Continue reading...
items.content: Environment ministry says most of the deaths were in the mountainous central province of Dak LakThe death toll from major flooding in Vietnam has risen to 90, with 12 more people missing, the environment ministry said on Sunday after days of heavy rain and landslides.Relentless rain has lashed south-central Vietnam since late October and popular holiday destinations have been hit by several rounds of flooding. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: A 23-year-old Wisconsin woman who nearly stabbed a classmate to death to please Slender Man has been recaptured in Illinois after leaving a group home, officials say.
items.content: A 23-year-old Wisconsin woman who nearly stabbed a classmate to death to please Slender Man has been recaptured in Illinois after leaving a group home, officials say.

items.title: US woman behind Slender Man stabbing is missing after leaving group home
items.standfirst: Morgan Geyser of Wisconsin cut off her electronic monitoring device and was last seen with an acquaintanceA Wisconsin woman who admitted to stabbing a classmate nearly to death in 2014 to please the online horror character Slender Man is missing after she cut off an electronic monitoring device and left a group home, authorities said on Sunday.Madison police issued an alert on Sunday for Morgan Geyser, now 23, saying she was last seen around 8pm on Saturday with an adult acquaintance. Continue reading...
items.content: Morgan Geyser of Wisconsin cut off her electronic monitoring device and was last seen with an acquaintanceA Wisconsin woman who admitted to stabbing a classmate nearly to death in 2014 to please the online horror character Slender Man is missing after she cut off an electronic monitoring device and left a group home, authorities said on Sunday.Madison police issued an alert on Sunday for Morgan Geyser, now 23, saying she was last seen around 8pm on Saturday with an adult acquaintance. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Morgan Geyser, 23, was recaptured in Illinois.
Geyser had left a group home in Wisconsin.
She was involved in a 2014 stabbing case.
The stabbing was related to the Slender Man online character.
Authorities issued an alert after she cut off her monitor.

clusters.title: JFK's granddaughter, Tatiana Schlossberg, says she has terminal cancer diagnosis

items.title: JFK's granddaughter, Tatiana Schlossberg, says she has terminal cancer diagnosis
items.standfirst: Tatiana Schlossberg, who has been married to doctor George Moran since 2017, has two young children.
items.content: Tatiana Schlossberg, who has been married to doctor George Moran since 2017, has two young children.

items.title: Doctor discusses cancer diagnosis for JFK's granddaughter, Tatiana Schlossberg
items.standfirst: This weekend, 35-year-old Tatiana Schlossberg, a granddaughter of former President John F. Kennedy, announced she has terminal cancer. CBS News medical contributor Dr. Celine Gounder has a breakdown of the diagnosis.
items.content: This weekend, 35-year-old Tatiana Schlossberg, a granddaughter of former President John F. Kennedy, announced she has terminal cancer. CBS News medical contributor Dr. Celine Gounder has a breakdown of the diagnosis.

items.title: JFK's granddaughter shares terminal cancer diagnosis
items.standfirst: Tatiana Schlossberg, 35, says she was diagnosed shortly after giving birth in 2024 and has less than a year to live.
items.content: Tatiana Schlossberg, 35, says she was diagnosed shortly after giving birth in 2024 and has less than a year to live.

ai_summary: Tatiana Schlossberg, 35, announced a terminal cancer diagnosis.
She was diagnosed shortly after giving birth in 2024.
Schlossberg is a granddaughter of John F. Kennedy.
She is married to doctor George Moran.
Doctors estimate she has less than one year to live.

clusters.title: Banned Bosnian Serb leader Dodik’s party wins snap presidential elections
clusters.neutral_headline: Dodik Ally Wins Bosnian Serb Presidential Election
bullet_summary: 89% of the vote, preliminary results showed
81%, the central electoral commission said, based on nearly 93% of polling stations counted

items.title: Banned Bosnian Serb leader Dodik’s party wins snap presidential elections
items.standfirst: Bosnian Serb politician Sinisa Karan, the candidate backed by dismissed president Milorad Dodik, won Sunday’s snap election with 50.89% of the vote, preliminary results showed. His main rival, Branko Blanusa, secured 47.81%, the central electoral commission said, based on nearly 93% of polling stations counted.
items.content: Bosnian Serb politician Sinisa Karan, the candidate backed by dismissed president Milorad Dodik, won Sunday’s snap election with 50.89% of the vote, preliminary results showed. His main rival, Branko Blanusa, secured 47.81%, the central electoral commission said, based on nearly 93% of polling stations counted.

items.title: Barred Bosnian Serb leader Dodik’s ally wins snap presidential election
items.standfirst: Sinisa Karan wins 50.89 percent while his main rival Branko Blanusa gets 47.81 percent, preliminary results show.
items.content: Sinisa Karan wins 50.89 percent while his main rival Branko Blanusa gets 47.81 percent, preliminary results show.

ai_summary: Sinisa Karan, backed by Milorad Dodik, won the election.
Karan secured 50.89% of the vote in preliminary results.
His main rival, Branko Blanusa, received 47.81% of votes.
The results are based on nearly 93% of polling stations counted.
Dodik was previously barred from running for office.

clusters.title: U.S. lawmakers, allies voice concern over Trump’s Ukraine peace proposal
clusters.neutral_headline: US and Allies Voice Concerns Over Ukraine Peace Proposal
bullet_summary: "The Ukrainians haven't said anything concrete about what has been changed in the plan, nor did Rubio
Clearly the Ukrainians are in a very difficult position," said FRANCE 24's correspondent in Kyiv, Ukraine Gulliver Cragg

items.title: U.S. lawmakers, allies voice concern over Trump’s Ukraine peace proposal
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio traveled to Switzerland for meetings with Ukrainian and European officials on Sunday as U.S. efforts to coordinate a Ukraine peace plan were clouded by concerns over the origins of the proposal from both U.S. lawmakers, along with European allies. NBC News’ Molly Hunter reports.
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio traveled to Switzerland for meetings with Ukrainian and European officials on Sunday as U.S. efforts to coordinate a Ukraine peace plan were clouded by concerns over the origins of the proposal from both U.S. lawmakers, along with European allies. NBC News’ Molly Hunter reports.

items.title: 'The Ukrainians haven't said anything concrete about what has been changed in the plan'
items.standfirst: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio boasted "tremendous" progress after a day of meetings with Ukrainian and European officials in Geneva on a proposal to halt the Ukraine war, but numerous uncertainties remain. "The Ukrainians haven't said anything concrete about what has been changed in the plan, nor did Rubio. Clearly the Ukrainians are in a very difficult position," said FRANCE 24's correspondent in Kyiv, Ukraine Gulliver Cragg.
items.content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio boasted "tremendous" progress after a day of meetings with Ukrainian and European officials in Geneva on a proposal to halt the Ukraine war, but numerous uncertainties remain. "The Ukrainians haven't said anything concrete about what has been changed in the plan, nor did Rubio. Clearly the Ukrainians are in a very difficult position," said FRANCE 24's correspondent in Kyiv, Ukraine Gulliver Cragg.

items.title: U.S. and Ukraine hold talks as lawmakers and allies voice concern over Russian 'wish list'
items.standfirst: Secretary of State Marco Rubio has landed in Switzerland for meetings with Ukrainian and European leaders on Sunday.
items.content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio has landed in Switzerland for meetings with Ukrainian and European leaders on Sunday.

ai_summary: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with officials in Switzerland.
Discussions focused on a proposal to halt the Ukraine war.
US lawmakers and European allies expressed concerns.
The origins of the peace plan are under scrutiny.
Ukrainians have not specified changes to the plan.

clusters.title: Nigeria: 'The government has decided to close all schools in the region'
clusters.neutral_headline: Schools Closed in Nigeria After Student Kidnappings
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, Sky News World

items.title: Nigeria: 'The government has decided to close all schools in the region'
items.standfirst: Fifty of the more han 300 students kidnapped from a Nigerian Catholic school last week have escaped and have been reunited with their parents, the Catholic Church and Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) said on Sunday. While waiting for more information, the Nigerian government has decided to close all schools in the region.
items.content: Fifty of the more han 300 students kidnapped from a Nigerian Catholic school last week have escaped and have been reunited with their parents, the Catholic Church and Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) said on Sunday. While waiting for more information, the Nigerian government has decided to close all schools in the region.

items.title: Dozens of kidnapped schoolchildren escape as Pope Leo appeals for release of remaining abductees
items.standfirst: At least 50 of the 303 children abducted this week from a Catholic school in Nigeria have escaped and been reunited with their families, a church group has said, as Pope Leo pleaded for their immediate release.
items.content: At least 50 of the 303 children abducted this week from a Catholic school in Nigeria have escaped and been reunited with their families, a church group has said, as Pope Leo pleaded for their immediate release.

ai_summary: Fifty students escaped after being kidnapped in Nigeria.
The kidnappings occurred at a Catholic school.
The Nigerian government decided to close regional schools.
Pope Leo appealed for the release of remaining abductees.
Over 300 students were initially abducted.

clusters.title: Ex-Brazil president says he tried to prize open ankle tag after 'hallucinations'
clusters.neutral_headline: Bolsonaro Claims "Psychotic Attack" Led to Ankle Tag Tampering
bullet_summary: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro has said "hallucinations" and a nervous breakdown led to an attempt to tamper with his electronic ankle tag
Reported by Sky News World, Guardian World

items.title: Ex-Brazil president says he tried to prize open ankle tag after 'hallucinations'
items.standfirst: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro has said "hallucinations" and a nervous breakdown led to an attempt to tamper with his electronic ankle tag.
items.content: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro has said "hallucinations" and a nervous breakdown led to an attempt to tamper with his electronic ankle tag.

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro claims ‘psychotic attack’ made him tamper with ankle monitor
items.standfirst: Brazil’s former president says he took a soldering iron to electronic tag as he was hallucinating that it was buggedBrazil’s far-right former president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he took a soldering iron to his electronic ankle monitor after having a substance-induced “psychotic attack” that caused him to hallucinate that the device was bugged.Bolsonaro made the claim during a custody hearing on Sunday, 24 hours after he was arrested at his home in the capital, Brasília, amid suspicions he was planning to abscond to a foreign embassy to avoid being sent to jail to serve a 27-year sentence for masterminding a failed coup. Continue reading...
items.content: Brazil’s former president says he took a soldering iron to electronic tag as he was hallucinating that it was buggedBrazil’s far-right former president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he took a soldering iron to his electronic ankle monitor after having a substance-induced “psychotic attack” that caused him to hallucinate that the device was bugged.Bolsonaro made the claim during a custody hearing on Sunday, 24 hours after he was arrested at his home in the capital, Brasília, amid suspicions he was planning to abscond to a foreign embassy to avoid being sent to jail to serve a 27-year sentence for masterminding a failed coup. Continue reading...

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro arrested after tampering with ankle tag ‘out of curiosity’
items.standfirst: Brazilian ex-president says he used soldering iron on device and is now in custody over fears he was going to abscondBrazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he tried to damage his electronic ankle monitor “out of curiosity” after he was arrested at his villa owing to suspicions he was poised to abscond.In a video released by the supreme court, Bolsonaro – who was recently sentenced to 27 years in prison for masterminding a military coup – can be heard admitting to a security official that he had used a soldering iron to tamper with the black tag. Continue reading...
items.content: Brazilian ex-president says he used soldering iron on device and is now in custody over fears he was going to abscondBrazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he tried to damage his electronic ankle monitor “out of curiosity” after he was arrested at his villa owing to suspicions he was poised to abscond.In a video released by the supreme court, Bolsonaro – who was recently sentenced to 27 years in prison for masterminding a military coup – can be heard admitting to a security official that he had used a soldering iron to tamper with the black tag. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Jair Bolsonaro said he tampered with his ankle monitor.
He claimed "hallucinations" caused the tampering.
Bolsonaro said he thought the device was bugged.
He was arrested after the incident.
Bolsonaro is facing a 27-year sentence.

items.content: Europe has tabled a counter proposal to the US-Russia draft peace plan for Ukraine.

items.title: Ukraine has no choice but to engage with US peace plan
items.standfirst: The American proposal is biased in favour of Russia. But it is not the final word
items.content: The American proposal is biased in favour of Russia. But it is not the final word

ai_summary: Europe has presented a counter proposal.
The counter proposal is for the US-Russia peace plan.
The US-Russia plan is for Ukraine.
The Financial Times says Ukraine must engage.
The American proposal favors Russia.
